thread.title: FXSpotStream Bolsters Business Development Team With BAML Hire
thread.title_full: FXSpotStream Bolsters Business Development Team With BAML Hire

title: FXSpotStream Bolsters Business Development Team With BAML Hire
text:
FXSpotStream Bolsters Business Development Team With BAML Hire FXSpotStream Bolsters Business Development Team With BAML Hire Evelina Rosenstein joins FXSpotStream from BAML who will land at the group's business development team in London. Advertising Print This Post 
FXSpotStream has bolstered its personnel group, adding Evelina Rosenstein as the newest addition to its Business Development team, according to information made public on her Linkedin profile. 
In her new role at FXSpotStream, Ms. Rosenstein will be based out of the group’s London office, who begins her new role with immediate effect. She joins FXSpotStream after working a wide range of positions over the past decade. Most recently, she served at Bank of America Merrill Lynch (BAML) in its EFX and Foreign Exchange (FX) Algo Sales division in London for a decade, dating back to 2005. 
Additional stops include positions at Bloomberg, Argentina’s Comision Nacional de Valores and the Banco Central de la República Argentina. 
Last month, FXSpotStream announced the launch of a new web-based HTML5 GUI . In an accord with SmartTrade and its technology suite, the new GUI added to their existing downloadable platform and API connection that had been available for accessing FXSpotStream’s liquidity. 
FXSpotStream (FSS) is a bank-owned consortium, providing a multibank price aggregation service to clients – the group helps execute spot, forward, FX swaps, and precious metals trades. FSS’ liquidity providers include Bank of America (BofA) Merrill Lynch, BNP Paribas, Citi, Commerzbank AG, Credit Suisse, GS, HSBC, J.P. Morgan, Morgan Stanley, Standard Chartered, and UBS.
